name: updates
doc: Check for and install Hydra updates.

items.doc: Called after updates.check() runs, with a boolean parameter specifying whether an update is available. Default implementation pushes a notification when an update is available with the tag 'showupdate'.
items.name: available

items.doc: Checks for an update. If one is available, calls updates.available(true); otherwise calls updates.available(false).
items.name: check

name: repl
doc:
The REPL (Read-Eval-Print-Loop) is excellent for exploring and experiment with Hydra's API.

It has most of the familiar readline-like keybindings, including C-b, C-f, M-b, M-f to navigate your text, C-p and C-n to browse command history, etc.

Type `help` in the REPL for info on how to use the documentation system.

items.doc: Opens a new REPL; the `opts` parameter is an optional table with keys: inputcolor, stdoutcolor, resultcolor, backgroundcolor; these are 6-digit CSS-like hex strings.
items.name: open

name: timer
doc: Execute functions with various timing rules.

items.doc: Stops all running timers; called automatically when user config reloads.
items.name: stopall

items.doc: Returns the number of minutes in seconds.
items.name: minutes

items.doc: Returns the number of weeks in seconds.
items.name: weeks

items.doc: Runs the function after sec seconds.
items.name: doafter

items.doc: Stops the timer's fn from getting called until started again.
items.name: stop

items.doc: Returns the number of hours in seconds.
items.name: hours

items.doc: Runs the function exactly once in the entire lifespan of Hydra; reset only when you quit/restart.
items.name: runonce

items.doc: Begins to execute timer.fn every timer.seconds; calling this does not cause an initial firing of the timer immediately.
items.name: start

items.doc: Creates a new timer that can be started. Has the fields: seconds, fn.
items.name: new

items.doc: Returns the number of days in seconds.
items.name: days

items.doc: Returns the number of seconds in seconds.
items.name: seconds

name: settings
doc: Functions for user-defined settings that persist across Hydra launches.

items.doc: Gets the Lua value for the given string key.
items.name: get

items.doc: Saves the given value for the string key; value must be a string, number, boolean, nil, or a table of any of these, recursively.
items.name: set

name: notify
doc: Apple's built-in notifications system.

items.doc: Unregisters a function to no longer be called when an Apple notification with the given tag is clicked.
items.name: unregister

items.doc: Unregisters all functions registered for notification-clicks; called automatically when user config reloads.
items.name: unregisterall

items.doc: Show an Apple notification. Tag is a unique string that identifies this notification, and will be passed to notify.clicked() if the notification is clicked. None of the strings are optional, though they may each be blank.
items.name: show

items.doc: Registers a function to be called when an Apple notification with the given tag is clicked.
items.name: register

name: application
doc: Manipulate running applications.

items.doc: Returns the bundle identifier of the app.
items.name: bundleid

items.doc: Launches the app with the given name, or activates it if it's already running.
items.name: launchorfocus

items.doc: Returns the localized name of the app (in UTF8).
items.name: title

items.doc: Returns whether the app is currently hidden.
items.name: ishidden

items.doc: Returns only the app's windows that are visible.
items.name: visiblewindows

items.doc: Assuredly terminates the app.
items.name: kill9

items.doc: Returns all running apps.
items.name: runningapplications

items.doc: Hides the app (and all its windows).
items.name: hide

items.doc: Tries to activate the app (make it focused) and returns its success.
items.name: activate

items.doc: Tries to terminate the app.
items.name: kill

items.doc: Returns any running apps that have the given bundleid.
items.name: applicationsforbundleid

items.doc: Returns all open windows owned by the given app.
items.name: allwindows

items.doc: Unhides the app (and all its windows) if it's hidden.
items.name: unhide

items.doc: Returns the running app for the given pid, if it exists.
items.name: applicationforpid

name: menu

items.doc: Hides Hydra's menubar icon.
items.name: hide

items.doc: Shows Hyra's menubar icon. The function should return a table of tables with keys: title, fn, checked (optional), disabled (optional)
items.name: show

name: window
doc:
Functions for managing any window.

To get windows, see `window.focusedwindow` and `window.visiblewindows`.

To get window geometrical attributes, see `window.{frame,size,topleft}`.

To move and resize windows, see `window.set{frame,size,topleft}`.

It may be handy to get a window's app or screen via `window.application` and `window.screen`.

See the `screen` module for detailed explanation of how Hydra uses window/screen coordinates.

items.doc: Returns the title of the window (as UTF8).
items.name: title

items.doc: Get all windows on all screens that match window.isvisible.
items.name: visiblewindows

items.doc: Returns the role of the window, whatever that means.
items.name: role

items.doc: Returns all visible windows, ordered from front to back.
items.name: orderedwindows

items.doc: True if the window is currently minimized in the dock.
items.name: isminimized

items.doc: Get every window except this one.
items.name: otherwindows_allscreens

items.doc: Returns the subrole of the window, whatever that means.
items.name: subrole

items.doc: Set the frame of the window in absolute coordinates.
items.name: setframe

items.doc: True if the window's subrole indicates it's 'a standard window'.
items.name: isstandard

items.doc: Get other windows on the same screen as self.
items.name: otherwindows_samescreen

items.doc: The top-left corner of the window in absolute coordinates.
items.name: topleft

items.doc: Make this window the main window of the given application; deos not implicitly focus the app.
items.name: becomemain

items.doc: Returns the app that the window belongs to.
items.name: application

items.doc: Moves the window to the given point in absolute coordinate.
items.name: settopleft

items.doc: Get all windows north of this one, ordered by closeness.
items.name: windows_to_north

items.doc: Returns all windows
items.name: allwindows

items.doc: Get all windows south of this one, ordered by closeness.
items.name: windows_to_south

items.doc: Try to make this window focused.
items.name: focus

items.doc: Get all windows east of this one, ordered by closeness.
items.name: windows_to_east

items.doc: Focus the first focus-able window to the east of this one.
items.name: focuswindow_east

items.doc: Focus the first focus-able window to the west of this one.
items.name: focuswindow_west

items.doc: Focus the first focus-able window to the north of this one.
items.name: focuswindow_north

items.doc: Returns the focused window, or nil.
items.name: focusedwindow

items.doc: True if the app is not hidden or minimized.
items.name: isvisible

items.doc: Minimizes the window.
items.name: minimize

items.doc: The size of the window.
items.name: size

items.doc: Focus the first focus-able window to the south of this one.
items.name: focuswindow_south

items.doc: Un-minimizes the window.
items.name: unminimize

items.doc: Get the screen this window is mostly on.
items.name: screen

items.doc: Get all windows west of this one, ordered by closeness.
items.name: windows_to_west

items.doc: Get the frame of the window in absolute coordinates.
items.name: frame

items.doc: Make this window fill the whole screen its on, without covering the dock or menu.
items.name: maximize

items.doc: Resizes the window.
items.name: setsize

name: autolaunch
doc:
Functions for controlling whether Hydra launches at login.

To make sure Hydra launches at login, put this in your config:

    autolaunch.set(true)

items.doc: Sets whether Hydra launches when you login.
items.name: set

items.doc: Returns whether Hydra launches when you login.
items.name: get

name: pathwatcher
doc:
Watch paths recursively for changes.

This simple example watches your Hydra directory for changes, and when it sees a change, reloads your configs:

    pathwatcher.new(os.getenv("HOME") .. "/.hydra/", hydra.reload):start()

items.doc: Unregisters pathwatcher's fn so it won't be called again until the pathwatcher is restarted.
items.name: stop

items.doc: Returns a new pathwatcher that can be started and stopped. Contains fields: path, fn.
items.name: new

items.doc: Calls p:stop() for all started pathwatchers; called automatically when user config reloads.
items.name: stopall

items.doc: Registers pathwatcher's fn as a callback when pathwatcher's path or any descendent changes.
items.name: start

name: logger
doc: Functionality to assist with debugging and experimentation.

items.doc: List of lines logged so far; caps at logger.maxlines. You may clear it by setting it to {} yourself.
items.name: lines

items.doc: Maximum number of lines to be logged.
items.name: maxlines

items.doc: Unregisters a function that handles new log lines.
items.name: removehandler

items.doc: Opens a textgrid that can browse all logs.
items.name: show

items.doc: Registers a function to handle new log lines.
items.name: addhandler

name: ext
doc: Standard high-level namespace for third-party extensions.

name: utf8
doc: Utilities for handling UTF-8 strings 'correctly'.

items.doc:
Splits the string into groups of (UTF-8 encoded) strings representing what humans would consider individual characters.

The result is a sequential table, such that table.concat(result) produces the original string.
items.name: chars

items.doc: Returns the number of characters as humans would count them.
items.name: count

name: geometry
doc: Mathy stuff.

items.doc: Convenience function for creating a point-table.
items.name: point

items.doc: Returns hypotenuse of a line defined from 0,0 to point.
items.name: hypot

items.doc: Rotates a point around another point N times.
items.name: rotateccw

items.doc: Returns the intersection of two rects as a new rect.
items.name: intersectionrect

items.doc: Convenience function for creating a size-table.
items.name: size

items.doc: Convenience function for creating a rect-table.
items.name: rect

items.doc: Returns the midpoint of a rect.
items.name: rectmidpoint

name: textgrid
doc: Super easy in-Hydra GUI windows.

items.doc: Calls the given function when the textgrid is closed. Defaults to nil.
items.name: closed

items.doc: Closes the given textgrid window.
items.name: close

items.doc: Sets the textgrid's background color to the given 6-digit hex string.
items.name: setbg

items.doc: Resizes the textgrid to the number of rows and columns given in the size-table with keys {x,y}.
items.name: resize

items.doc: Sets the given 1-character UTF-8 encoded string at the given grid coordinates.
items.name: set

items.doc: Changes the title of the textgrid window.
items.name: settitle

items.doc: Calls the given function when a key is pressed in the focused textgrid. The table t contains keys {ctrl, alt, cmd, key}. Defaults to nil.
items.name: keydown

items.doc: Sets the new font of the textgrid, potentially changing its visible size (no resize event is fired).
items.name: usefont

items.doc: Returns the window that represents this textgrid.
items.name: window

items.doc: Gets the name and pointsize currently used in the textgrid.
items.name: getfont

items.doc: Brings the textgrid to front and focuses it; implicitly focuses Hydra.
items.name: focus

items.doc: Sets the textgrid's foreground color to the given 6-digit hex string at the given coordinate.
items.name: setcharfg

items.doc: Sets the textgrid's background color to the given 6-digit hex string at the given coordinate.
items.name: setcharbg

items.doc: Prevents the textgrid from closing when your config is reloaded.
items.name: protect

items.doc: Opens a new textgrid window.
items.name: open

items.doc: Closes all non-protected textgrids; called automatically when user config is reloaded.
items.name: closeall

items.doc: All currently open textgrid windows; do not mutate this at all.
items.name: textgrids

items.doc: Calls the given function when the textgrid is resized. Defaults to nil.
items.name: resized

items.doc: Set whether a textgrid window has a border.
items.name: sethasborder

items.doc: Set whether a textgrid window has a shadow.
items.name: sethasshadow

items.doc: Sets the textgrid's foreground color to the given 6-digit hex string.
items.name: setfg

items.doc: Replaces all the textgrid's text with space characters.
items.name: clear

items.doc: Returns the size (nubmer of rows and columns) as a size-table with keys {x,y}.
items.name: getsize

name: json
doc: Functions for converting between Lua values and JSON strings.

items.doc: Returns a Lua value representing the given JSON string.
items.name: decode

items.doc: Returns a JSON string representing the given value; if prettyprint is true, the resulting string will be quite beautiful.
items.name: encode

name: hotkey
doc:
Create and manage global hotkeys.

The `mods` field is case-insensitive and may any of the following strings: "cmd", "ctrl", "alt", or "shift".

The `key` field is case-insensitive and may be any single-character string; it may also be any of the following strings:

F1, F2, F3, F4, F5, F6, F7, F8, F9, F10, F11, F12, F13, F14, F15, F16, F17, F18, F19, F20
PAD, PAD*, PAD+, PAD/, PAD-, PAD=, PAD0, PAD1, PAD2, PAD3, PAD4, PAD5, PAD6, PAD7, PAD8, PAD9, PAD_CLEAR, PAD_ENTER
RETURN, TAB, SPACE, DELETE, ESCAPE, HELP, HOME, PAGE_UP, FORWARD_DELETE, END, PAGE_DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, DOWN, UP

items.doc: Shortcut for: return hotkey.new(...):enable()
items.name: bind

items.doc: Creates a new hotkey that can be enabled. The hotkey has the public fields: key, mods, fn.
items.name: new

items.doc: Registers the hotkey's fn as the callback when the user presses key while holding mods.
items.name: enable

items.doc: Disables the given hotkey; does not remove it from hotkey.keys.
items.name: disable

items.doc: Disables all hotkeys; automatically called when user config reloads.
items.name: disableall

name: screen
doc:
Manipulate screens (i.e. monitors).

You usually get a screen through a window (see `window.screen`). But you can get screens by themselves through this module, albeit not in any defined/useful order.

Hydra's coordinate system assumes a grid that is the union of every screen's rect (see `screen.frame_including_dock_and_menu`).

Every window's position (i.e. `topleft`) and size are relative to this grid, and they're usually within the grid. A window that's semi-offscreen only intersects the grid.

items.doc: Returns the 'main' screen, i.e. the one containing the currently focused window.
items.name: mainscreen

items.doc: Returns the screen's rect in absolute coordinates, without the dock or menu.
items.name: frame_without_dock_or_menu

items.doc: Set the tint on a screen; experimental.
items.name: settint

items.doc: Returns the screen 'after' this one; I have no idea how they're ordered though.
items.name: next

items.doc: Returns the screen's rect in absolute coordinates, including the dock and menu.
items.name: frame_including_dock_and_menu

items.doc: Returns a screen's frame in its own coordinate space.
items.name: frame

items.doc: Returns all the screens there are.
items.name: allscreens

items.doc: Returns a screen's frame in its own coordinate space, without the dock or menu.
items.name: vislbleframe

items.doc: Returns the screen 'before' this one; I have no idea how they're ordered though.
items.name: previous

name: hydra
doc: General stuff.

items.doc: Just like pcall, except that failures are handled using hydra.errorhandler
items.name: call

items.doc: Sets whether Hydra has a Dock icon, and thus can be switched to via Cmd-Tab.
items.name: putindock

items.doc: Convenience wrapper around dofile() and hydra.userfile(name)
items.name: douserfile

items.doc: Makes Hydra the currently focused app; useful in combination with textgrids.
items.name: focushydra

items.doc: Returns whether accessibility is enabled. If passed `true`, prompts the user to enable it.
items.name: check_accessibility

items.doc: Returns the full path to the file ~/.hydra/{name}.lua
items.name: userfile

items.doc: Returns a UUID as a string
items.name: uuid

items.doc: Displays the standard OS X about panel; implicitly focuses Hydra.
items.name: showabout

items.doc: The path of the built-in lua source files, with no trailing slash.
items.name: resourcesdir

items.doc: Error handler for hydra.call; intended for you to set, not for third party libs
items.name: errorhandler

items.doc: Checks if a file exists, and whether it's a directory.
items.name: fileexists

items.doc: Reloads your init-file. Makes sure to clear any state that makes sense to clear (hotkeys, pathwatchers, etc).
items.name: reload

items.doc: Shows a message in large words briefly in the middle of the screen; does tostring() on its argument for convenience..
items.name: alert

items.doc: Runs a shell function and returns stdout as a string (without trailing newline).
items.name: exec

items.doc: Returns whether Hydra has a Dock icon, and thus can be switched to via Cmd-Tab.
items.name: indock

name: webview
doc: For showing stuff in web views!

items.doc: Called (if set) when the webview closes.
items.name: closed

items.doc: Loads the given URL in the webview.
items.name: loadurl

items.doc: Loads the given string in the webview; basepath must be an absolute path.
items.name: loadstring

items.doc: Set whether a webview window has a border.
items.name: sethasborder

items.doc: Set the title of a webview window.
items.name: settitle

items.doc: Loads the given file in the web view.
items.name: loadfile

items.doc: Opens and returns a new webview instance; as with all other Hydra objects, it's just a table, and you're free to set whatever keys you want on it.
items.name: open

items.doc: Set whether a webview window can be interacted with via the mouse.
items.name: setignoresmouse

items.doc: When level is -1, window is always below all others; when 0, window is normal; when 1, window is above all others.
items.name: setlevel

items.doc: Return the window that represents the given webview.
items.name: window

items.doc: When a link is clicked with a URL like 'hydra:foo', this function is called (if set) with 'foo' as its argument.
items.name: clicked

items.doc: Set whether a webview window has a shadow.
items.name: sethasshadow

name: fnutils
doc: Super-helpful functional programming utilities.

items.doc: Returns a table of the results of fn(el) on every el in t.
items.name: map

items.doc: Runs fn(el) for every el in t, and assuming the results are tables, combines them into a new table.
items.name: mapcat

items.doc: Runs fn(el1, el2) for every el in t, then fn(result, el3), etc, until there's only one left.
items.name: reduce

items.doc: Adds all elements of t2 to the end of t1.
items.name: concat

items.doc: Returns whether the table contains the given element.
items.name: contains

items.doc: Returns a table of the elements in t in which fn(el) is truthy.
items.name: filter

items.doc: Returns the index of a given element in a table, or nil if not found.
items.name: indexof

items.doc: Returns the first element where fn(el) is truthy.
items.name: find

items.doc: Runs fn(el) for every el in t.
items.name: each

name: mouse
doc: Functions for manipulating the mouse cursor.

items.doc: Moves the mouse to the given location on the current screen.
items.name: set

items.doc: Returns the current location of the mouse on the current screen as a point.
items.name: get
